text: - Have you tried Eton mess?
It is a classic British dessert
and it's ridiculously easy.
Here's your next favorite no-bake dessert.
(bright music)

Hey everybody, it's Natasha
of natashaskitchen.com
Eton mess.

It's an interesting name, but
this dessert is such a treat.
It's three parts.

Fresh berries, whipped
cream, and meringue cookies,
and it doesn't get any easier than this.
And I'm totally craving this.
My sweet tooth is speaking.
So let's get started.
Also, let us know if you can find Sharky
somewhere in the video.
We've got him hidden and let me know

Plus, if you haven't

And when you do click
that little bell icon

so you'll get notifications

All right, let's do this.
Strawberries.

You'll need one pound
of fresh strawberries.
Cut off the tops.

Then cut the strawberries
into quarters or smaller
if your strawberries are very large.

This dessert is one of my
favorite ways to use up
sweet summer strawberries,

but you can also use winter
strawberries, if you have to,
and just add more sugar to taste.

Add those to a large mixing
bowl, then set aside one third
of your chopped strawberries.
Into your mixing bowl,
add some fresh lemon zest.
You'll need a teaspoon of zest
and two teaspoons of lemon juice.
Just make sure to zest the lemon
before you squeeze the juice,
otherwise, it's very difficult to zest.

Add sugar to your strawberries,
adding it to taste.
I like to start with two tablespoons
and if I'm using some sour strawberries,
I do like to add a little more.
Coarsely mash up those strawberries.
I like to use a potato masher,
but you can also use an immersion blender
just to get it to a chunky consistency.
Now, add back in the remaining one third
of your chopped strawberries,
and just stir to combine.

The larger pieces of
strawberry add great texture
to this strawberry sauce.
Next, you'll need three to four ounces
of vanilla meringue cookies.
That's about 10 to 12 of these cookies.
I'm using store bought meringue cookies,

and I will leave a link to
these in the recipe notes,

but you can also make crisp
vanilla meringue cookies
from scratch.

Set the cookies into a
zip top bag and crush them
into course crumbles.

You can use a rolling
pin or the smooth side
of a meat mallet, or even a sauce pan.

I love having a blend of
small, medium and larger size
crumbles for these,

and they definitely
don't have to be perfect.
Now for the whipped cream,

you'll need one and a half
cups of heavy whipping cream.

Get that right out of the
fridge just before you start
to beat it.
Add a tablespoon of granulated sugar

and beat on medium high
speed until stiff peaks form.
It's about three to four minutes.
All right, that looks perfectly whipped.

Make sure you don't over beat,
or whipped cream will start
to turn buttery.
Now all that's left to do is to assemble
the Eton mess dessert.
You can use clear drinking glasses
or your serving cup of choice.

Here's how to assemble
an Eton mess dessert.

Spoon some whipped cream
into the bottom of the cup.
And you're gonna top that

with a generous amount
of strawberry sauce.

And I love how those
chunks of strawberries look
in this dessert.
Just irresistible.
Next, add some crushed meringue.
Now we're gonna repeat those layers,
adding more whipped cream.
(light music)

Top that with another generous
layer of strawberry sauce
and finish it off with another layer
of crushed meringue cookies.

And I love how the syrup from
the strawberries drips down

onto every layer infusing
every bit of this
with so much fresh strawberry flavor.

all the different parts,

Or you can even assemble
